- <indent=1.5em>2 X MFGS  PROCEED TO  DK 07 OR DK 16 – DEPENDING WHERE IS SECONDARY SA</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>1 X MFG PROCEED TO AFT OR FWD ENGINE COMPARTMENT DK 30 – DEPENDING WHICH CASING IS THE FIRE</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>BACK UP  1 & 3 STAY AT STAGING AREA ON DK 02</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>BACK UP 2  PROCEED TO SECONDARY STAGING AREA ON DK  07 OR DK 16</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>STRETCHER TEAM  #1  PROCEED TO  STAGING AREA ON DK 02</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>STRETCHER TEAM  #2  PROCEED TO  STAGING AREA ON DK 07 OR DK 16</indent>



<indent=1.5em>IN CASE SEARCH OF THE AREA IS REQUIRED 2 STAGING AREAS AND 2 FCPS NEED TO BE UTILIZED AND ANNOUNCED. DEPENDING ON THE TEMPERATURE IN THE AFFECTED AREA EITHER DK 07 OR DK 16 WILL BE CHOOSEN.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>UHF CH 1 & 2   TO BE ASSIGNED FOR COMMUNICATION WITH FCP 1 & STAGING AREA 1.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>UHF CH 3 & 4   TO BE ASSIGNED FOR COMMUNICATION WITH FCP 2 & STAGING AREA 2.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>NOTE: BRIDGE TO HAVE ANOTHER ADDITIONAL UHF RADIO!</indent>

killCardSteps.title: initial actions
killCardSteps.notes:
- <indent=1.5em>hi-fog activation (always first initial action with any technical space fire)</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>bridge to close adjacent wtd and fd.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>manual closing of the flaps on dk 2 (this will stop the extraction fan as well)</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- THIS STEP IS DONE ONLY AS PER CHIEF ENGINEER DISCRETION!</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- location of push buttons for manual closing –</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- FWD CASING,  DK 0 STAIRCASE 5A IN FRONT OF ENTRANCE TO COMP. 13</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- AFT CASING,  DK 2 BEHIND THE DOOR TO COMP. 16 FROM I-95</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>esd - if needed (emergency shut down activation will stop all the equipment in compartment 14 or 15 including diesel engines and all ventilation)</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- attention - if the situation allows and fire/smoke can be contained only with shutting down the flaps consider avoiding esd to avoid black out. eventually ecr will changeover the engines to not affected compartment.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>5.  monitoring situation on dk 16 where are emergency generators and emergency switchboard rooms</indent>

killCardSteps.title: fire fighting techniques
killCardSteps.notes:
- <indent=1.5em>confirm hi fog release:</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- - from ecr or scc</indent>

<indent=5.5em>- - srv located  dk 2, port side, at the entrance to staircase 6b mid, next to ecr</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>two hose entry with foam and water wall for sar and ff.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>foam stations located at emergency generator room 01 and 02. more foam buckets available from fire lockers 01, 02, 04, 05, engine room dk 30 and ffa locker dk 6 fwd ps. on each deck in casing room there are extinguishers and fire hoses available.</indent>

killCardSteps.title: boundary cooling
killCardSteps.notes:

- <indent=1.5em>fwd: mfz 5 aft port side & starboard side</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>aft:   mfz 6 fwd port side & starboard side</indent>

killCardSteps.title: power and ventilation
killCardSteps.notes:
- <indent=1.5em>consider shutting off power and vent in affected areas.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>all doors to be closed</indent>

killCardSteps.title: hazardous materials
killCardSteps.notes: - <indent=1.5em>high temperature of burning metal, dark smoke from burning pipeline.</indent>

killCardSteps.title: considerations
killCardSteps.notes:
- <indent=1.5em>ba controller should be assigned to each fcp.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>for boundary cooling operations in engine casing additional crew members will be required to stand by on each deck. consider utilizing assistance group # 39.</indent>

- <indent=1.5em>evacuate guests from operation area on dk15.</indent>
